Believe it or not, DIET is the most important factor for muscle growth to occur. Without proper nutrition, supplementation and hydration you will make little or no gains and find yourself very frustrated and most likely quit because you won\'t be seeing any gains..\n Proper nutrition which contains enough vitamins, minerals, proteins, and a little bit of fat is necessary for any kind of person which is targeting muscle growth or fat reduction.

Body building constitutes 70-30 ratio of diet and exercise respectively.\n Mainly people suffer with the issue of not meeting the desired amount of protein for their body. No doubt there is more protein content in non vegetarian meals but you can still fulfill your protein intake with some vegan diet which can contain things like BROCCOLI, TOFU, PANEER, SOYBEAN, DOUBLE TONNED MILK etc. These all contains enough amount of protein if you are a VEGAN. Apart from this meat eaters can easily fulfill their need of protien, other sources of food which are rich in protein content are: EGGS, CHICKEN, FISH, RED MEAT etc..

Everyone makes commitment towards building muscles while gaining or losing weight in the gym with the prescribed diet chart given by the trainer but most of them fails to stick to their proper diet routine. These points will help you to stick to your diet and get the desired result:
 1.Stay motivated.
 2.Avoid temptation.
 3.Don't punish yourself.
 4.Don't go hungry.
 5.Don't diet alone.
 6.Prepare your routine well.

The weight loss "TOPIC" is full of myths. People are being advised to do all sorts of crazy things, most of which have no evidence behind them. Here are those small expert tips which will surely help you:
 1.Drink Enough Water(4-5 lt per day). Especially Before Meal(4-5 lt per day).
 2.Drink green tea , cook with coconut oil, cut back on added sugar.
 3.Do light weight training with more repetitions.
 4.Mainly focus on low carbs diet + low calories.
 5.To develop muscle while losing weight you should add low carbs plus high protein to your diet schedule.

Although weight-loss strategies are ubiquitous in the fitness industry, not every person in the world has that goal. How to gain weight:
 1.Eat more calories than you expend.
 2.Eat nutrient-dense, calorie-rich food.
 3.Increase dietary fat intake.
 4.Add a weight-gainer supplement.
 5.Lift heavy weight.

Cardio exercise is any exercise that raises your heart rate. Face it our bodies were made to move. And we all know that to keep our muscles in shape we need to move them.
 This movement makes them stronger and stronger muscles make for a more efficient and healthy body.
Basically Cardio should be done by each and everyone because it helps in gaining stamina which will be helpful in not only in the gym but in your daily day to day schedule also. It burns more body fat in limited period of time, which is why including them in your fitness regime is a must.
 They not only contribute to weight loss, but they can also help you gain good muscles and strengthen your immune system. If you are doing cardio in the gym then you can do it yourself in your home or outdoor also, light jogging/running, skipping, jumping jacks etc will be enough for a normal person if he/she is not targeting any kind of extreme goal.
 Aerobic activities that improve cardiovascular health include:
 1.Walking.
 2.Jogging or running.
 3.Cycling.
 3.Swimming.
 4.Aerobics.
 5.Rowing.
 6.Stair climbing.
 7.Hiking

Common gym etiquette that should be followed by everyone:
 Dos:
 1.Do dress appropriately in the gym.
 2.Do wear a deodorant so that you don't trouble others.
 3.Do share equipment.
 4.Do share the water.
 5.Do place your weights back on the rack when you have finished with them.
 6.Do keep your perspiration (sweat) to yourself.
 7.Do stay at home if you are sick.
 8.Do take a quick shower if you know there are others waiting on line to take a shower. 

 Don'ts:
 1.Don\’t talk on your cell phone on the gym floor.
 2.Don\’t make loud noises.
 3.Don\’t interrupt anyone while exercising
 4.Don\’t carry your gym bag or personal belongings with you on the gym floor.
 5.Don\’t offer unsolicited advice.
 6.Don\’t stare.
